Cook-Off

The 20th Anniversary of the Carpenter’s Cook-Off 2024!

When:
October 13, 2024
12 noon to 3 pm

Where:

The Birchmere
3701 Mt Vernon Ave
Alexandria, VA 22305

What:

  • Restaurant Tastings
  • Live Music
  • Live and Silent Auction
  • Raffles
  • Children’s Corner

Buy Tickets HERE!

Check back for updates in the next few months.

Please join us on Sunday, October 13th, 2024, from 12 noon to 3 pm at The Birchmere and indulge in an afternoon of food and fun while supporting Carpenter’s Shelter! At the 20th Anniversary of the Carpenter’s Cook-Off 2024, attendees will enjoy tastings from 20 area restaurants, bid on hot ticket items during the live and silent auctions, and listen to live music.

Check out Carpenter’s Cook-Off 2024 participants and check back regularly for updates!

Meet our 2024 Celebrity Judges!

 

Sarah Stusek is an internet sensation known for her candid, down-to-earth food reviews and engaging storytelling skills on social media. She has been writing, producing and editing food videos online, earning over 300K followers between TikTok, Instagram and YouTube. Sarah has released two novels in the past year, Three Rivers based on her time at a wilderness therapy program as a teenager and Fake It Till You Make It, based on her time living in Hollywood. She also started her own nonprofit at the beginning of this year, Proper Help, which provides lunch to children in need.

Debby Critchley has lived in Alexandria since 1987. As the Food Editor for The Zebra Press for over 12 years, she has tasted her way through much of Alexandria and nearby restaurants. Raised in the Chicago area, her parents cultivated her palate with visits to restaurants specializing in the foods of France, Italy, China, Spain, and more. Her mother claimed her first word was ‘escargot.’ Ms. Critchley holds an M.A. and has recently retired from providing technical writing and document management. An avid dog lover, she has fostered more than 30 dogs in her home and is a dog mom to Beo.

 

 

 

Samantha McCrimmon began her tenure at The Carlyle Hotel in New York City. She later attended Kevin Zraly’s Windows on the World Wine School at the iconic One World Trade Center, cementing her passion for wine, cuisine and culture. Samantha has developed numerous wine programs, wine classes and sales training classes in New York City. She currently designs and spearheads the wine program at L’Avant-Garde, in Georgetown.

 

 

Carpenter’s Cook-Off would not be possible without the generous support of our caring community.

Sponsorship of Cook-Off is essential to reaching our annual fundraising goal for this event. We are so grateful for these outstanding community partnerships, which enable us to continue working towards our mission of ending homelessness in Northern Virginia.

Is your company interested in sponsoring?  Click here  for more information including a full list of benefits.

Thank you to our 2024 Cook-Off Sponsors!

Host Committee is a passionate circle of individuals who support the Cook-Off and the shelter by providing financial support and inviting friends to join in. Host Committee members receive tickets to the Cook-Off as well as pre-and-post event recognition. Looking forward to seeing all of our Host Committee on October 13th!

Many thanks to our Carpenter’s Cook-Off Host Committee!

What are the levels and benefits of Host Committee? Read below to learn more!

Feast Membership – $1,000

  • Name on Cook-Off webpage
  • Name in Cook-Off program

  • 2 tickets to Cook-Off
  • Name on Cook-Off webpage
  • Name in Cook-Off program

You Can Buy Tickets to the Carpenter’s 20th Anniversary Cook-Off HERE.

Ticket Type Early Bird (August 5- August 31) Regular (September 1 – October 11) At the Door (October 13)

Child (ages 12 and under) $ 20 $ 25 $ 30

Looking for a fun, easy way to give to Carpenter’s Shelter?

Interested in donating a one-of-a-kind auction item? Email Meghan Cole, Development Associate, at
MCole@CarpentersShelter.org.

Live Auction Sneak-Peak

Thank you to Pedego Electric Bikes Alexandria for sponsoring one of our live auction items (Cruise in Comfort!) at this year’s Carpenter’s Shelter Cook-Off! We greatly appreciate your support!

 

Get ready to cruise in style and comfort with this amazing Pedego 26” Comfort Cruiser Electric Bike! This electric bike boasts a high-performance 36-volt, 17.5 amp-hour battery that can take you on incredible journeys for up to 50 miles on a single charge. Pedal with ease or simply twist the throttle for an effortless ride, thanks to the convenient pedal assist and throttle options. With reliable disc brakes, you’ll experience unmatched stopping power for safety and control, even on downhill rides. Not only does this bike deliver top-notch performance, but you can also choose from a variety of colors to match your personal style. Don’t miss your chance to own this fantastic Pedego Comfort Cruiser Electric Bike!
